    • Method Detail

      • createGame

        public void createGame(java.lang.String gamer,
                       int numfilas,
                       int numcolumnas,
                       int nummirrors)
        creation of the matrix and initialization of the attributes of the game zone class
        pre: post: a game zone type object in addition to the initialization of the variables.
        Parameters:
        gamer - the variable that stores the player's username. gamer != null.
        numfilas - the number of rows in the matrix. numfilas != null.
        numcolumnas - the number of columns in the matrix. numcolumnas != null.
        nummirrors - the number of mirrors in the matrix. nummirrors != null.

      • AsigMirrow

        public void AsigMirrow(int rowmirrow,
                       int colmirrow,
                       int direction,
                       Cell nodo)
        Go through the matrix and locate the mirrors generating their address
        pre: Relationships in the matrix must be created post: a cell with an assigned mirror
        Parameters:
        rowmirrow - the coordinate in rows. rowmirrow != null.
        colmirrow - the coordinate in columns. rowmirrow != null.
        direction - direction of the mirror. direction != null.
        nodo - element to traverse the matrix.

      • getStartray

        public void getStartray(int f,
                        int c)
        returns the cell where the beam is going to be fired and stores it in the current variable
        pre: Relationships in the matrix must be created and cowls and rows post: the cell where the beam begins to shoot
        Parameters:
        f - rows. f != null && f <= numfilas.
        c - columns. c != null && c <= numcolumnas.

        public void addScore(Score newScore)
        add a score to the binary search tree.
        pre: post: the new score becomes the root
        Parameters:
        newScore -

      • addScore

        public void addScore(Score recur,
                     Score newScore)
        add a score to the binary search tree.
        pre: the score cannot be null and there must be a root post: an added score.
        Parameters:
        recur - current score. recur != null.
        newScore - the new score to add. newScore != null.

      • inOrden

        public java.lang.String inOrden()
        returns the string generated by the in-order method led by the root
        pre: root created and filled post: string with the information of the binary search tree
        Returns:
        String score.

      • inOrden

        public java.lang.String inOrden(Score recur)
        generates a string with the data name and score of the players
        pre: The scores must exist and the binary search tree cannot be empty. post: string with sorted data from binary search tree
        Parameters:
        recur - current score. recur != null.
        Returns:
        String score
